content:
This very short PR proposes adding a fact instance for a proposition that, to me, looks too specialised to deserve being promoted to a typeclass. With this in mind, I've just left this comment but I'm a bit dissatisfied with my rather vague words there.

Do we have any documentation (or even a thread) with something more precise about when it's OK to use fact?
I think there's a note called fact non-instances. Could this not use docs#ne_zero?
(you'd probably also want docs#ne_zero.pos, which doesn't exist but can work for canonically_ordered_add_monoids)
Oh great, the library note was just what I wanted. I read the fact doc string but somehow didn't cast my eyes five lines lower!
